title: Golden Gate National Recreation Area: Volunteer Opportunities & Internships
body: Volunteer Opportunities and Internships         Academic Intern Maria volunteers on Crissy Field. NPS/Roland Greenberg  There are Many Options for Volunteers Golden Gate National Recreation Area, Muir Woods National Monument, and Fort Point National Historic Site all partner with the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy to fill volunteer positions.  Looking for a fun volunteer opportunity for your family? These opportunities are great for teens, young people, and families. Work together, and enjoy each other's company while contributing to your community. Please visit the Youth & Family Volunteer Opportunity page on the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy website. Want to volunteer in the parks with your group? Volunteering together is a great team building activity for corporate groups, community programs, youth groups and schools. Please visit the Group Volunteer page on the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy website. Interested in individual short-term volunteer opportunities? Come enjoy the scenic landscape while providing your helping hands. Your contribution is vital to nurture the health and beauty of our parks and the community. Please visit the Individual Volunteer page on the Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy website. Are you a CCSF or SFSU student looking to get involved? There are many diverse opportunities to gain valueable experience working in the park through the Academic Internship program. To learn more, please visit the following link: Academic Internship Opportunities Long term volunteer opportunities are offered by the National Park Service. (Living in park options may be available).  Â     Current Volunteer Opportunities
